description.narrative: The proposed project is an IFC investment of up to USD 66 million in A shares in the Green for Growth Fund (the Fund or GGF) which was launched in December 2009 and by year-end 2018 has reached total investment portfolio of EUR 463 million. Promoted by KfW Entwicklungsbank (KfW) and European Investment Bank (EIB), GGF is a collective investment vehicle with unlimited life, providing financing to sustainable energy projects primarily through financial institutions (FIs), renewable energy projects (PF), energy service companies (ESCOs), and service and supply companies, collectively partner institutions (PIs) in Europe and its neighborhood. IFC has initially invested in the Fund in 2010. Through this Project IFC aims to provide financing for the Fund to continue its increasing reach in catalyzing the development and capacity building in sustainable commercial lending market for energy efficiency and renewable energy investments in the target regions.

i) Project outcome: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is increased access to climate mitigation finance, such as renewable energy, energy efficiency, and other green financing in the Fund's operational regions of ECA and MENA. The Project will also result in reducing carbon emissions and energy savings in energy intensive and highly polluted regions.
ii) Market creation: IFC anticipates that the Project will enhance integration among public and private investors in the green financing segment by demonstrating to the wider investor community that climate mitigation investments represent an attractive risk-reward profile for all parties. IFC also anticipates that the investment will promote greater market sustainability through climate finance capacity building in ECA and MENA.

participating-org.narrative: Green for Growth Fund, Southeast Europe S.A., SICAV-SIF

name.narrative: Domiciled in Luxembourg, the Fund is investing in 19 countries in Central and Eastern Europe and European neighborhood as well as Middle East and North Africa.
